rationale: This species is known only from one collection locality in the Gulf of California, which is in need of verification. More information is needed on this species' range, population status, habitat requirements and threats. It is listed as Data Deficient.
habitat: This species is poorly known.
threats: There are no major threats known for this species.
population: This species is only known from one collection locality, which may be erroneous.
range: This species endemic to the Eastern Pacific and is only known from the type locality thought to be in northwestern of Gulf of California.
conservationActions: There are no known conservation measures for this species.

rationale: This species is found in deep water and is confined to the Galapagos Islands. There is no information available on the population status or its habitat, or the impact of potential threats. This species is listed as Data Deficient.
habitat: This species was recorded from a depth of 115 m.
threats: There are no known major threats for this species.
population: There is no population information available for this species, it is only known from a few specimens.
range: This species is known only from the Galapagos Islands.
conservationActions: There are no species-specific conservation measures in place for this species. The Galapagos Islands are a designated marine reserve with a total area of 133,000 km<sup>2</sup>.

rationale: It is not certain if this is a valid species and, if it is, it is known from only one specimen and has not be seen in over 100 years, so no information is available on its distribution, population status, ecological requirements or threats. It is therefore listed as Data Deficient.
habitat: There is no information on this species' habitat requirements or ecology.
threats: As there is no information on the precise locality where this species was collected, or even whether it is in Madagascar, it is not possible to identify possible threats.
population: There is no information on the population of this species, which is known from only one specimen.
range: It is not certain if this species occurs on Madagascar or not; if it does it has not be seen in over 100 years. If it is not Madagascan, its distribution within mainland Africa is unknown.
useTrade: The species is not known to be used or traded.
conservationActions: Further research is required to determine the taxonomic identity and true distribution of this taxon. If relocated, it will be necessary to obtain data on its ecological requirements, population status, exposure to and sensitivity to threats.

rationale: This species is currently known only from the western Italian coast. Nothing is known of population trends or threats. It is therefore assessed as Data Deficient at present.
habitat: This is a benthopelagic species.
threats: This species has no commercial importance. It is never or rarely used for aquaculture and the aquarium trade.
population: There is no information available about population trends or density.
range: This species is endemic to the Mediterranean, known only off the west coast of Italy in the Tyrrhenian and Ligurian Seas.
conservationActions: There is no information available on specific conservation measures for this species in the Mediterranean

rationale: The Nevis Rice Rat has never been definitely reported extant during the European historical period. However, it is known to have survived until almost immediately prior to European arrival in the Caribbean, suggesting strongly that pre-Columbian human impacts did not cause its disappearance and that it persisted into the historical period. Several reports of rats being eaten on Nevis and St. Kitts, in one instance of animals specifically described as “unusual-looking” (i.e. suggesting a difference from introduced black rats), have been reported from the seventeenth, eighteenth, and twentieth centuries, until the 1930s, and may well represent this species. However, several weeks of survey work in 2009 (involving live trapping with Sherman and Tomahawk traps) at various elevations in the forests of Nevis Peak found no evidence of the Nevis Rice Rat’s continued survival, and instead discovered very high densities of invasive mongoose and black rats throughout the island’s forests (Turvey unpublished data). The species is therefore assessed as Extinct.
habitat: Nothing is known about this species’ habitat or ecology. This island rice rat was about the same size as a black rat, and therefore much smaller than Megalomys, the other recently extinct endemic insular Caribbean rice rat genus.
threats: The cause of extinction of the Nevis Rice Rat is unknown. However, its survival until the European historical era suggests that its extinction may have been driven by predation or competition with invasive mammals, probably introduced black rats or mongoose.
population: This species is now extinct.
range: The Nevis Rice Rat formerly occurred on the three main islands of the Saint Kitts Bank (Nevis, Saint Kitts and Saint Eustatius). It has been recorded from numerous pre-Columbian zooarchaeological sites, as it constituted a major component of the diet of prehistoric Amerindians.
useTrade: This species was widely exploited by Amerindians for food during the recent prehistoric period, but its continued presence in kitchen middens dating closely before European arrival in the Caribbean c.500 years ago suggests that this exploitation did not seriously impact its population. Animals specifically identified as rats, and therefore possibly representing this species, were described as providing “good meat” on St. Kitts (Harlow 1925), and in 1720 it was reported that “in Nevis some people do eat Rats, wrapping them up in banano-leaves to bake them as it were under warm embers” (Merrill 1958). There are reports of unusual-looking rats occurring on Nevis and being eaten by inhabitants of the island until the 1930s (Turvey et al. 2010).
conservationActions: This species is Extinct.

rationale: The population density of this species was known in the past. The current population density is not known, and the species has declined since the 1970s but has been confirmed to still occur in Lake Victoria in low numbers. The threat responsible for its dramatic decline in the early 1980s was the introduction of the Nile Perch (Lates niloticus) to Lake Victoria. Although recent surveys suggest that this species may have started increasing in numbers, it is still very likely only to be found at a few locations, and it is therefore assessed as Vulnerable.
habitat: This is a pelagic species from the littoral and sub-littoral zone, occurring over sand and mud. It is classified as a zooplanktivore.
threats: The main threat to this species is predation by Nile Perch (a potentially reversible threat). It is also potentially threatened by hybridization due to decreased water transparency (on account of eutrophication and erosion leading to increased sedimentation and runoff) interfering with mate recognition visual cues (Mrosso et al. 2003).
population: This species has declined in numbers dramatically since 1980. Frequency of occurrence data per 10 min trawling in Mwanza Gulf (based on the value at the station with the highest frequency, with 10-28 catches, Witte et al. 1992) show a decrease from 90% in 1979-82, to 0% in 1987/88 and 1993/95, and less than 1% for 2006/08.
range: This species is endemic to Lake Victoria. It has been recorded in surveys carried out in Kenya, Tanzania and Uganda (Greenwood 1981).
conservationActions: Many fish species within Lake Victoria have suffered severe and dramatic declines since the introduction of the Nile Perch. Although numbers of the perch have now decreased, the degradation of the water quality is also thought to be having a significant impact on some fish species. More research is needed to monitor this species and how it is affected by these threats, as well as establishing the extent of its range within the lake. Policy based action is needed to decrease the degradation of the lake, as well as to prevent over fishing. Protected areas should also be established.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of the absence of recent information on its extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: The type specimens were collected from a spring-fed swamp in paperbark woodland.
threats: There are no known threats to this species and it occurs in a remote region with little human disturbance.
population: It is known only from the type specimens and one other specimen. It has only been collected once since its discovery in 1905.
range: The type locality for this species is Cox River on Alexandria Station in the middle of Northern Territory, Australia (15° 43'S; 135° 37'E). This species' estimated altitudinal range is 0-200m asl.
conservationActions: Its range does not include any protected areas.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of continuing doubts as to its taxonomic validity.
habitat: There is no information on the habitat and ecology of this species, the only specimen of which was found in a beer bottle at a plant nursery.
threats: There is no information on threats to this species.
population: It is known only from a single female specimen collected in 1954, and numerous subsequent searches by various herpetologists have failed to find this form again. If it ever existed, it will probably have to be considered extinct.
range: Assuming that this is a valid species, it is known only from the type locality,Town Bush Valley, in Pietermaritzburg in KwaZulu-Natal Province, South Africa.
conservationActions: It is not known from any protected areas.

rationale: Listed as Least Concern in view of its probable wide distribution, presumed large population, and because it is unlikely to be declining fast enough to qualify for listing in a more threatened category.
habitat: The species inhabits dense grassland subject to flooding. Breeding biology is unknown.
threats: There are no known threats to the species and it occurs in a remote region with little human disturbance.
population: It is only known from a few specimens.
range: This Australian endemic is known from a few specimens collected from the Mitchell Plateau in the Kimberley region of Western Australia, and from Keep River and Kirkimbie Station in the Northern Territory. It probably occurs more widely than current records suggest, especially in areas between known sites. The estimated altitudinal range of the species is from 150-300m asl.
conservationActions: The range of the species includes Keep River National Park and Mitchell River National Park.

rationale: Listed as Least Concern in view of its wide distribution, presumed large population, and because it is unlikely to be declining fast enough to qualify for listing in a more threatened category.
habitat: The species inhabits shrubland and open floodplains. It shelters under dense low growing vegetation and logs. Breeding occurs in February after cyclonic rains. Spawn and tadpoles are unknown.
threats: There are no known threats to the species and it occurs in a remote region with little human disturbance.
population: It is a common species.
range: This Australian endemic is confined to the lower Fitzroy River in the Kimberley Region of Western Australia. The extent of occurrence of the species is approximately 38,400km2. The estimated altitudinal range of the species is from 0-300m asl.
conservationActions: Its range does not include any protected areas.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of continuing doubts as to its taxonomic validity, extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: Nothing is known regarding its habitat and ecology, although it presumably breeds by larval development in water.
threats: The threats to this species are not known.
population: There is no information on its population status.
range: This species' distribution is not known. The type locality of "Yoruba (Lagos)" (Peters 1875), Nigeria, is believed to be an error, and it is not possible to map the distribution of this taxon.
conservationActions: It is not known if it occurs in any protected areas.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of the continuing doubts as to its taxonomic validity, and absence of recent information on its extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: There is nothing known about its habitat or ecology, although it is presumably a water-breeding species, with larval development.
threats: The type locality is threatened by conversion to agricultural land (including tea plantations), and the development of regional infrastructure (such as roads).
population: It is known only from the lost holotype, so its population status is not known.
range: This species is known only from the type locality, "Kempholey, Hassan District, Mysore State" (Rao 1937), in the central Western Ghats of India. The collection is believed to have taken place at an altitude between 200 and 300m asl.
conservationActions: Field surveys are urgently required to collect a neotype.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of continuing doubts as to its taxonomic validity, and the absence of recent information on its extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: This is a terrestrial species described from relatively open tropical moist forest. It may occur under rocks close to hill streams, but there is no further information known about its habitat and ecology.
threats: The threats to this species are not known.
population: It is known only from the holotype, as it has not been found again despite surveys within its range, so its population status is unknown.
range: This species is known only from the type locality of "near Valiaparai Thodu, Silent Valley Forests, Kerala" (Pillai 1981) in the Western Ghats of southern India. The type specimen was collected at an altitude of 800m asl.
conservationActions: It is unclear as to whether or not the type specimen was collected within Silent Valley National Park.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of continuing problems with its taxonomy as well as absence of recent information on its extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: There are no details known regarding its habitat and ecology.
threats: There is no direct information on threats to this species.
population: Its population status is not known.
range: This species' original description indicates that it was collected close to the Rio Chiriqui near Bocas del Toro, Panama. This is doubted by Dunn and Stuart (1951) and Savage (1972), who suggested that the true type locality was in South America, possibly Peru or Bolivia. In view of the uncertain distribution of this species it is not possible to map its range.
conservationActions: It is not known if it occurs in any protected areas.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of continuing uncertainties as to its extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: This is a species of subtropical forest that has also been found in slightly degraded habitats near very small villages. No information is known about its breeding habits, but it presumably breeds in water by larval development.
threats: There is some limited habitat loss taking place due to subsistence agriculture, but overall the forest within its range is not significantly threatened at the moment.
population: It appears not to be a common species, and only six were encountered during a four month survey in northern Myanmar.
range: This species is known only from northern Myanmar and extreme north-eastern India. At present it is known only from the following localities: Putao Plain (the type locality) in Kachin State, northern Myanmar; the area 20-30km to the east of the type locality in Putao Plain in Kachin State, northern Myanmar; Htamanthi, in northern Myanmar on the border with India; and extreme north-eastern India in Arunachal Pradesh and possibly in Assam. It is presumed to occur in between these localities, and probably also elsewhere, but due to lack of sampling in Myanmar and north-eastern India it has not yet been recorded more widely. Recent records from Myanmar are at 556-640m asl.
conservationActions: In northern Myanmar it has been found in Hkakabo Razi National Park and Htamanthi Protected Area.

rationale: Listed as Vulnerable because its Extent of Occurrence is less than 20,000 km2, it is known from fewer than ten locations, and there is continuing decline in the extent and quality of its habitat in Rio Grande do Sul, southern Brazil.
habitat: There is no information about its ecology or biology in the literature. It presumably breeds in water.
threats: There is no information on threats to this species, although there has been extensive habitat loss in its range due to urbanization in the last 30 years. The Coastal Atlantic Forest is considered to be one of the smallest and the most threatened ecosystems in Rio Grande do Sul (Fontana et al. 2003 in Escobar et al. 2004).
population: The species had not been recorded since 1960, until its recent rediscovery (one juvenile) in 2004 (Escobar et al. 2004).
range: This species is known only from the type locality: Torres, Rio Grande do Sul State, Brazil. The type locality is listed as a municipality, which has since been divided into several municipalities.
conservationActions: There are no protected areas near where this species was collected. It is categorized as Vulnerable on the Brazil national list.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of continuing doubts as to its taxonomic validity as well as absence of recent information on its extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: There are no details regarding its habitat and ecology, but it is presumably a lowland forest species that breeds in rain pools.
threats: The threats to this species are not known, but might include deforestation of lowland forest.
population: It is known only from the holotype, so there is no information on its population status.
range: This taxon is known only from a single female specimen collected from the Akar (= Akah) River, Sarawak, Malaysia. As the specific collection locality on the Akah River could not be located, a distribution map cannot be completed for this species.
conservationActions: It is not known if it occurs in any protected areas.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of continuing doubts as to its taxonomic validity, extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: There are no details regarding its habitat and ecological requirements, although it presumably breeds in water by larval development.
threats: The major threats to this species are not known.
population: Its population status is not known.
range: This taxon has been recorded from a non-specific locality in the Mérida Andes, in western Venezuela, at 2,400m asl.
conservationActions: It is not known currently to occur in any protected areas.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of continuing doubts as to its taxonomic validity, extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: The habitat and ecological requirements of this species are not known, but it presumably breeds in water by larval development.
threats: There is no information on major threats to this species.
population: Its population status is not known.
range: This taxon is known only from the type locality of Monte Duida, at 610m asl, in Amazonas Department in Venezuela.
conservationActions: It is not currently known from any protected areas.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of continuing doubts as to its taxonomic validity, extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: There is no information on the habitat and ecology of this species, though it is likely to breed in water.
threats: There is no information on threats to this species.
population: The population status of this species is unknown.
range: This species occurs in Pakitsa, Parque Nacional Manu, Peru, and along the Jurua River, Acre State, Brazil, at approximately 250m asl. Note that the verbal range description in Morales (2000) does not match the map for this species in the same publication.
conservationActions: It is found in at least one protected area: Parque Nacional Manu, Peru.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of continuing uncertainty as to its taxonomic status.
habitat: There is no information on its habitat and ecology, although the larvae presumably develop in water.
threats: There is no information on threats to this species.
population: There is no information on the population status of this species.
range: This species occurs to the north of the left bank of the Amazon River and the Rio Trombetas drainage, in Pará State, Brazil, and in the drainages of the Amazon and Maranon Rivers in Loreto, Peru.
conservationActions: This species occurs in at least two protected areas in Peru.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient since it has only relatively recently been discovered, and there is still very little information on its extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: It has been found at night on a rock in the margins of the Verde River. The type locality is closed forest and open areas so it is not clear exactly which habitat it was found in.
threats: There is no direct information on threats to this species.
population: It is not thought to be a common species, and only a few specimens have been recorded.
range: This species is known from the type locality (Estação Ecológica da Juréia-Itatins, in the state of São Paulo, Brazil), and from one other locality about 10km away. It was recorded around sea level.
conservationActions: The entire range of this species is within the protected area of the Estação Ecológica da Juréia-Itatins, although maintenance and conservation of its habitat within the park is required.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of the absence of recent information on its extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: The region of the type locality is lowland tropical rainforest. There is no information regarding this species' breeding habits, although it presumably breeds by larval development in water.
threats: The major threats it faces are unknown. However, the region of the type locality is within an undisturbed, isolated region of forest.
population: There is no information on the population status of this species, which is known from only one specimen.
range: This species is known only from the non-specific type locality in Guyana of "valley of the Demerara River, British Guiana" (Ruthven 1919). The exact location is not known and hence no distribution map can be drawn for this assessment.
conservationActions: More taxonomic research is desirable as this might prove to be a juvenile of another species.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of continuing doubts as to its taxonomic validity as well as absence of recent information on its extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: There is no information known regarding its habitat preferences or ecological requirements. However, other species within its taxonomic group breed in ponds.
threats: Deforestation is presumably a threat to this species, although there is not enough information known at present to determine its major threats.
population: It has only been collected once, so its population status is not known. It is very similar to other species in its taxonomic group in the surrounding region.
range: This species is known only from the type locality, São Vicente, in São Paulo State, Brazil.
conservationActions: The taxonomic status of this species within its taxonomic group needs to be resolved.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of continuing doubts as to its taxonomic validity, extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: Neither its habitat nor its ecological requirements are known, although it presumably breeds in water by larval development.
threats: The threats to this species are not known.
population: The population status of this species is not known.
range: This species is known only from the unspecified distribution of "Brasilia" (Schneider 1799), presumably Brazil.
conservationActions: It is not known if it occurs in any protected areas.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of continuing doubts as to its taxonomic validity.
habitat: There are no details regarding its habitat and ecological requirements.
threats: The threats to this species are not known.
population: There is no information regarding its population status.
range: The type locality and distribution of this species are not known.
conservationActions: There is no information available describing whether or not this species occurs in any protected areas.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of continuing doubts as to its taxonomic validity, extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: There is no information regarding its habitat and ecological requirements, although it is likely to breed in water.
threats: The threats to this species are unknown.
population: The population status of this species is not known.
range: This species is known only from the imprecise type locality of Beni Province, Bolivia.
conservationActions: It is not known if it occurs in any protected areas.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of continuing uncertainties as to its extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: Its preferred habitat is unknown (the habitat of the type locality was not given in the original description), but if it is similar to other species of the genus it possibly frequents forest. There is no information known about its breeding habits, though again if it is similar to other members of the genus reproduction is presumably by larval development in streams.
threats: There is no information on threats to this species.
population: This species was described from only one specimen, so its population status is unknown, and no further collections have been made in the type locality.
range: This species is known only from Mongaguá in the state of São Paulo, Brazil, although the exact locality is not known. It might occur more widely, but this has not yet been confirmed.
conservationActions: To aid its conservation, more research is urgently needed into its extent of occurrence, ecological requirements and population status, in particular to determine whether or not it has a restricted range, if it is subject to any major threats, and if it occurs in any protected areas.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of continuing uncertainties as to its taxonomic status, extent of occurrence and ecological requirements.
habitat: There is no information on its habitat and ecological requirements, although it presumably breeds in water.
threats: There is no information on threats to this species.
population: The population status of this species is unknown.
range: This species is known only from the lost holotype from the state of Bahia. No map of its range can be drawn because of the lack of specificity of the type locality. This name cannot be assigned to any known species, though Hoogmoed and Gruber (1983) speculated that it could refer to Hyla nebulosa.
conservationActions: There is no information on conservation measures for this species.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of continuing uncertainties as to its extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: It breeds in bromeliads in montane moist forest, but very little other ecological information is known.
threats: There is very little information regarding potential threats to this species.
population: It is known from fewer than 10 specimens, so its population status is not known. No attempts have been made to return to the localities for many years to try to collect the species.
range: This species is known only from the Serra da Bocaina and the Serra Itatiaia, in Rio de Janeiro and São Paulo States, in south-eastern Brazil, although it might occur more widely. It occurs above 1,200m asl.
conservationActions: Both of the known localities are in protected areas.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of the absence of recent information on its extent of occurrence, threats, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: It is presumably a largely aquatic species that has a larval development breeding strategy.
threats: There is no information on threats to this species.
population: Its population status is not known.
range: This name cannot be related to any known population of frogs in the wild, and this species is only known from the unspecified locality of South America.
conservationActions: It is not known if this species occurs in any protected areas.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of continuing doubts as to its taxonomic validity, extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: It presumably breeds in waterbodies and has a larval development breeding strategy.
threats: The threats to this species are not known.
population: Its population status is not known.
range: This species is known only from the non-specific type locality of "Vulkangebiet nordöstlich des Kivu-Sees" (volcano region north-east of Lake Kivu, on the boundary between the Democratic Republic of Congo and Rwanda). It is not possible to determine which country this species was collected in.
conservationActions: It is not known if this species occurs in any protected areas.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of continuing doubts as to its taxonomic validity, extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: It presumably breeds in waterbodies and has a larval development breeding strategy.
threats: The threats to this species are not known.
population: Its population status is unknown.
range: This taxon is known only from the type locality of the general area of "Quilombo", Angola.
conservationActions: It is not known from any protected areas.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of the absence of recent information on its extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: It presumably occurs in leaf-litter in forest and breeds by larval development.
threats: The threats are unknown, but the type locality is within a protected area.
population: This species is known from only one specimen.
range: This species is known only from the type locality, Campos do Jordão, in São Paulo State, Brazil. This locality is at 1,700m asl.
conservationActions: The type locality is within a protected area (although it is not known exactly which one). Given the declines of high-altitude stream-breeding species in other parts of the wet tropics, surveys are urgently needed to relocate this species and to assess its status, especially in view of the lack of recent records. Some other Cycloramphus species have declined for unexplained reasons, and so it is an urgent priority to rediscover populations of this species.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of the absence of recent information on its extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: It presumably lives in leaf-litter, like other species in the genus, and breeds by larval development.
threats: The major threats are unknown, although the type locality is in a protected area, affording the species some indirect level of protection.
population: It is currently known from only two specimens.
range: This species is known only from the type locality, Alto Itatiaia, very close to the borders of Minas Gerais and Rio de Janeiro States, in Brazil, at around 2,200m asl.
conservationActions: The one known locality for this species is within Parque Nacional do Itatiaia. Given the declines of high-altitude stream-breeding species in other parts of the wet tropics, surveys are urgently needed to relocate this species and to assess its status, especially in view of the lack of recent records. Some other Cycloramphus species have declined for unexplained reasons, and so it is an urgent priority to rediscover populations of this species.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of the absence of recent information on its extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: Its habitat requirements are unknown, but the type locality was primary forest at the time of collection.
threats: The major threats are unknown, but the type locality is now within a protected area.
population: It is known only from the type specimen (which is in bad condition), so there is no information on its population status.
range: This species is known only from Paranapiacaba, in São Paulo State, Brazil, at around 800m asl.
conservationActions: The type locality of this species is within Parque Estadual da Serra do Mar.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of continuing doubts as to its taxonomic validity as well as absence of recent information on its extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: The type locality of this species is primary forest.
threats: There are no threats to the type locality at present, as it is undisturbed and isolated.
population: It is known from only a single specimen.
range: This species is known from Gran Rio, central Suriname, probably at around 250m asl.
conservationActions: The range of the species is not within any protected area. More research into the species' extent of occurrence, ecological requirements and population status is needed.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of the absence of recent information on its extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: There is no information known about the habitat or ecological requriments of this species, which presumably breeds by direct development.
threats: The threat to this species is unknown, but the type locality is within a protected area.
population: Its current population status is unknown as it has not been surveyed for in this area for over 30 years, although it was reportedly common in surveys of this area in the past.
range: This species is known from the Serra do Itatiaia, on the border of Rio de Janeiro and Minas Gerais States, Brazil, where it has been recorded from around 2,200m asl.
conservationActions: Its only known locality is within Parque Nacional do Itatiaia.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of continuing uncertainties as to its extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: It is known from the leaf-litter of forests. The type locality has both secondary and primary forest, but it is not known in which area exactly this species was collected from. It presumably breeds by direct development, like other species in the genus.
threats: There are no known threats to its habitat at present.
population: This species is only known from a few specimens, and there is no recent information on its population status.
range: This species is known only from the type locality in the Serra da Bocaina, São Paulo State, Brazil. The exact altitude of this locality is unknown, but it is probably at around 1,000m asl.
conservationActions: Its range is within Parque Nacional da Serra da Bocaina.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of continuing doubts as to its taxonomic validity, extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: Nothing is known about its habitat and ecological requirements, but it presumably breeds by larval development in water.
threats: Threats to this species are unknown.
population: There is no information on its population status.
range: This species is known only from the type locality, near Cartagena, in Colombia. The type locality is unspecific and hence it is not possible to determine the distribution of this species.
conservationActions: It is not known whether or not it occurs in any protected areas.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of continuing uncertainties as to its taxonomic status, extent of occurrence and ecological requirements.
habitat: There is no information on the habitat and ecological requirements of this species, which presumably breeds in water by larval development, like other members of the genus.
threats: There is no information on threats to this species.
population: It is known only from the type series collected in the 1960s.
range: This species is known only from the type locality, Itá Ibaté, in Corrientes Province, Argentina, at approximately 600m asl.
conservationActions: Its taxonomic status requires investigation.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of continuing uncertainties as to its extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: This is presumed to be a fossorial or terrestrial species, possibly associated with the leaf-litter substrate of tropical moist forest, which presumably breeds in water by larval development.
threats: It might be threatened by urbanization around Mayabunder.
population: It is known only from the type locality, where it is presumed to be rare.
range: This species is known only from the type locality of "Mayabunder (east of Burma temple), North Andamans" (Pillai 1977), in the Andaman Islands, India.
conservationActions: It has not been recorded from a protected area. Further surveys are needed to determine the range, habitat preferences and population status.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of the absence of recent information on its extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: This species presumably breeds in water by larval development.
threats: No information is available.
population: It has not been found since the original description in 1943, although the type locality is easily accessible for survey work.
range: This species is known only from the type locality, Da Lat on Lang Bian Plateau, Viet Nam.
conservationActions: Taxonomic studies of this species in relation to Microhyla annamensis and M. erythropoda are desirable.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of continuing doubts as to its taxonomic validity, extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: Its habitat and ecological requirements are not known, although breeding is thought likely to be by larval development, possibly underground, or in leaf axils or tree holes.
threats: The threats to this species are not known.
population: Its population status is not known.
range: Although the range of this species is not known, it is presumed to be restricted to Madagascar, as are all other species of Plethodontohyla.
conservationActions: It is not known from any protected areas.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of continuing doubts as to its taxonomic validity, extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: It presumably breeds by larval development in water.
threats: The threats to this species are not known.
population: Its population status is not known.
range: This taxon is known from the non-specific type locality of "Côte N.O. [north-west] de Madagascar", and no distribution map can be prepared for it.
conservationActions: It is not known if the species occurs in protected areas.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of continuing doubts as to its taxonomic validity, extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: It is presumed to breed by larval development in water.
threats: The threats to this species are not known.
population: The population status of this species is not known.
range: This taxon has been recorded from Lavenambato, in Tulear region, south-western Madagascar.
conservationActions: It is not known if the species occurs in protected areas.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of continuing doubts as to its taxonomic validity, extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: This is presumably an aquatic taxon with larval development.
threats: The specific threats to it are not known, though the type locality is now a large city.
population: Its population status is not known.
range: This taxon is known only from the type locality of Manila, Luzon Island, in the Philippines.
conservationActions: It is not known if the species occurs in protected areas.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of continuing doubts as to its taxonomic validity, extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: This is presumably an aquatic taxon with larval development.
threats: The threats to this species are not known.
population: Its population status is not known.
range: This species was originally described from the type locality of "Hong-Kong", China. The type specimens are believed to have been lost and a neotype (the holotype of Rana gracilis; Wiegmann, 1834) from Kap Shui Mun, Lantau Island, Hong Kong, China, was designated by Dubois and Ohler (2000).
conservationActions: It is not known if the species occurs in protected areas.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of continuing uncertainties as to its extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: This species presumably breeds in water by larval development.
threats: The threats to this species are unknown.
population: It is known only from the holotype.
range: This species is known only from the type locality of "Khugairk Reserve Forest, Manipur, India (alt. ca. 925m [asl])" (Chanda 1990). The limits of its distribution are still not known, and it might range more widely.
conservationActions: It is protected by national legislation.

rationale: Listed as Critically Endangered because its Area of Occupancy is probably less than 100 km2, its distribution is severely fragmented, and there is continuing decline in the extent and quality of its habitat
habitat: Presumably a forest species, it was recently collected close to a road and a stream. Like other members of the genus, it probably has aquatic larvae in streams.
threats: The major threat to the species is general habitat loss as a result of agriculture, including paddy fields and cash crops such as coconut and cashew.
population: The population status of this species is unknown.
range: This species is known only from the type locality "Kottigehar, Kadur", and from a recently discovered population at Bhadrea, in Chicamangalore District, Karnataka, in the Western Ghats of India. The altitude of the type locality is not known, but it was most recently collected at an altitude of approximately 1,000m asl. It appears to have a very small distribution.
conservationActions: It is not known whether or not this species occurs in any protected areas. Further survey work is required to determine the current population status of the species and the limits of its distribution range. It is protected by national legislation.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of continuing doubts as to its taxonomic validity as well as absence of recent information on its extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: The habitat preferences of this species are not known, although it is possibly a forest species. It presumably has aquatic larvae in streams, like other members of its genus.
threats: Assuming this species still exists, it is likely to have been threatened by changes in land use, as the area where it was collected from has been completely deforested.
population: It is known only from the holotype which is now lost, so there is no information regarding its population status.
range: This species is known only from the type locality, "Kottigehar, Kadur" (Rao 1937), in Karnataka, in the Western Ghats in India.
conservationActions: It is protected by national legislation.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of continuing doubts as to its taxonomic validity as well as absence of recent information on its extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: It is presumed that this is a moist tropical forest species that presumably has aquatic larvae in streams, like other species of Micrixalus.
threats: The area where it was collected, and might possibly still occur, is threatened by clearance for agricultural use (including plantations).
population: There is no information on its population status; it is known only from the lost holotype.
range: This species is known only from the type locality, "Kempholey, Hassan" (Rao 1937), in the Western Ghats of India, at around 200m asl.
conservationActions: It is protected by national legislation.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of the absence of recent information on its extent of occurrence, threats, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: Its preferred habitat type is not known, although it is presumed to breed in freshwater and to have a larval development breeding strategy.
threats: The threats to this species are not known.
population: It is known only from the lost type specimen.
range: This species is known only from the Khasi Hills in Meghalaya State, India.
conservationActions: It is not known if this species occurs in any protected areas.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of continuing doubts as to its taxonomic validity as well as absence of recent information on its extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: The habitat requirements of this species are not known. It is possibly a forest species that presumably breeds by larval development in streams.
threats: The area from where this species was collected is threatened by agricultural development, road construction and the development of tourism facilities.
population: It is known only from the lost holotype, so there is no information regarding its population status.
range: This species is known only from type locality of "Forests of Kempholey, Saklespur, Hassan, Mysore" (Rao 1937), in the Western Ghats of India, at around 400m asl.
conservationActions: This species is protected by national legislation.

rationale: Listed as Endangered because its Extent of Occurrence is less than 5,000 km2, all individuals are in fewer than five locations, and there is continuing decline in the extent and quality of its habitat in the Western Ghats of India.
habitat: The original collection took place in shallow water within disturbed tropical moist forest, close to a cardamom plantation. It is also believed to occur within undisturbed forest. It presumably breeds by larval development in streams.
threats: The major threat to this species is the cultivation of cardamom and tea in the buffer zone of Kalakad-Mundanthurai Tiger Reserve.
population: It is a recently described frog that has only been recorded twice, and is reportedly not a common species (Ravichandran pers. comm.).
range: This species is known only from the type locality within Kalakad-Mundanthurai Tiger Reserve in Tamil Nadu, in the southern Western Ghats of India, at an elevation of 700m asl.
conservationActions: It is currently known only from the Kalakad-Mundanthurai Tiger Reserve in Tamil Nadu, and it is included in national legislation. There is a need for further survey work to determine whether the species might occur outside the type locality.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of the absence of recent information on its extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: Its habitat is unknown, but it is presumably found in lowland and foothill rainforest. Reproduction is by direct development.
threats: Logging is potentially a threat to this species.
population: The population is unknown.
range: This species is known only from New Britain Island, Papua New Guinea, where its distribution is poorly documented.
conservationActions: The Extent of Occurrence, habitat requirements and population status of this species need to be documented. There are no confirmed records from protected areas.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of continuing doubts as to its taxonomic validity, extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: This is presumably an aquatic species that breeds by larval development.
threats: The threats to this species are not known.
population: Its population is not known.
range: This taxon is known only from the non-specific type locality of "Cordofan", which is in modern-day Sudan, and not in Egypt (Baha El Din pers. comm.).
conservationActions: It is not known if the species occurs in protected areas.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of continuing uncertainties as to its extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: There is little information available regarding its habitat and ecological requirements. It is said to be a bush frog, and probably occurs in montane forest. The original description mentions that it has a free-living larval stage, although this requires confirmation.
threats: Threats to this species are unknown.
population: It is still known only from the type collection.
range: This species is known only from two widely separated localities in north-eastern India: close to Cherrapunji town in Meghalaya State, and Namdapha Biosphere Reserve in the state of Arunchal Pradesh. It was collected at the type locality at around 1,330m asl. It presumably occurs more widely, in particular between the currently known sites.
conservationActions: It is not known whether or not this species occurs in any protected areas.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of the absence of recent information on its extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: The habitat requirements of this species are not known, but it presumably breeds in temporary pools.
threats: Threats to this species are unknown.
population: It is currently known with certainty only from the type specimen, which is recorded as lost by Dutta (1997), so there is no information regarding its population status.
range: This species is currently known with certainty only from the type locality of "Wattakole, Coorg" (Rao 1937) in India. A second site (Gumta, Karnataka) recently recorded by Padhye (pers. comm.), requires further confirmation and is not included in this assessment. Only the type locality has so far been used in attempts to map this species' distribution.
conservationActions: It is protected by national legislation. A more detailed taxonomic study of the possible second specimen is required.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of the absence of recent information on its extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: Nothing conclusive is known about the habitat or ecology of this species. Its breeding is unknown, and could be by either larval development or direct development.
threats: Threats to this species remain unknown.
population: Nothing is known regarding its population status, except that the type specimen is reported to have come from a very restricted locality.
range: This species is known only from the type locality in north-eastern India, although there is confusion over whether or not this refers to Darjeeling in West Bengal State, or Khasis in Meghalaya State. It is therefore not possible to attempt to produce a distribution map for this species until this confusion is resolved. This species was reportedly recorded from 1,000-1,500m asl.
conservationActions: It is not known whether or not this species occurs in any protected areas.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of the absence of recent information on its extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: It was collected in 'hill forest', although nothing else is known about its biology or ecology. It is presumed to breed by direct development.
threats: There is no direct information on threats to this species, although there is possibly some habitat loss taking place, as a result of the conversion of forest to agricultural land, that could be a threat.
population: It is known only from the type series, collected in 1882, so its current population status is unknown.
range: This species is known only from the non-specific type locality of "Malabar" (Boulenger 1882) in the Western Ghats of India.
conservationActions: Surveys are urgently needed to locate populations of this species.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of continuing problems with its taxonomy as well as absence of recent information on its extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: Nothing is known about the habitat and ecology of this species. It is not known if it has a direct development breeding strategy.
threats: The threats to this species are not known, although there has been a significant anthropic impact on the natural habitat in the Darjeeling area since it was described.
population: It is known only from the type collection, so there is no current information regarding its population status.
range: This species was collected in Darjeeling, in West Bengal State, India. Attempts to map its distribution for this assessment show the general area of Darjeeling.
conservationActions: It is not known if this species occurs in any protected areas.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of the absence of recent information on its extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: It is believed to be associated with the undergrowth of moist evergreen forest, where it presumably breeds by direct development (although this has not been confirmed).
threats: The threats to this species are not known.
population: It is known only from the type specimen, so there is no information regarding its population status.
range: This species is known only from the type locality of "Tura" (Boulenger 1919) in the Garo Hills in Meghalaya State, in north-east India.
conservationActions: It is not known whether or not this species occurs in any protected areas.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of continuing doubts as to its taxonomic validity as well as absence of recent information on its extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: The habitat requirements of this species are not known. It is likely to breed in water by larval development, like other members of the genus.
threats: Threats to this species are unknown.
population: It is known only from the holotype and one paratype.
range: This species is known only from the holotype and one paratype, and is said to come from Java, Indonesia. However, examination of the holotype has cast doubt as to the likelihood of it having an Asian origin (Iskandar pers. comm.).
conservationActions: Its taxonomic validity and locality of origin need to be determined.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of continuing uncertainties as to its extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: It presumably breeds by direct development.
threats: Threats to this species are unknown.
population: It is known only from museum specimens, and there are currently no known populations of this species.
range: This species is known only from the region of the type locality, which is "Peddavalasa (17° 47'N; 82° 16'E), ca. 1,000m altitude [asl], Vishakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh State, south-eastern India" (Das and Chanda 1998) in the Eastern Ghats of India.
conservationActions: It is not known from any protected areas. Further field studies in the area of collection are urgently required to learn more about this little-known frog, and determine its range, population status and habitat requirements.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of the absence of recent information on its extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: This species presumably occurs in lowland forest and breeds in water, but these details require confirmation.
threats: The specific threats to it are unknown, although it might be suffering from habitat loss.
population: It is known only from the holotype, so there is no information regarding its population status.
range: This species is known only from Sangihe Island in Sulawesi, Indonesia.
conservationActions: It does not occur in any protected areas.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of the absence of recent information on its extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: The habitat requirements of this species are not known. It presumably breeds in water by larval development, like most other members of its genus.
threats: Threats to this species are unknown.
population: It has not been recorded since it was first collected in 1937-39, so its population status is unknown. Results from recent surveys of the type locality are not yet available (Wogan pers. comm.).
range: This species is known only from a single specimen from Patsarlandam, northern Myanmar, close to the Chinese border (Smith 1940).
conservationActions: Its type locality is within Hkakabo Razi National Park. Further research might be required to resolve its taxonomic status.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of the absence of recent information on its extent of occurrence, threats, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: It is possibly associated with rivers in humid mountain valleys. It is presumed to breed in water and to have a larval development breeding strategy.
threats: The threats to this species are not known.
population: As this species is known only from the type series, there is no information regarding its current population status.
range: This species was described from the area "between Pamir and Samarkand", which is possibly in Kyrgyzstan, Tajikistan or Uzbekistan, although the exact collection localities are not known. There have been no more records of this species since the collection of the type series, so attempts to map its distribution have been based on the area most suitable for salamanders within the expedition route of the collector of the type series.
conservationActions: It is not known if this species occurs in any protected areas. It is an urgent priority to re-locate this species, and determine its conservation needs.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of the absence of recent information on its extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: It is presumably subterranean, like other members of its genus.
threats: There is no information on threats to this species.
population: There is no information on the population status of this species.
range: This species is known only from an unspecified type locality, presumed to be in Brazil.
conservationActions: It is in need of taxonomic review (Wilkinson pers. comm.).

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of the absence of recent information on its extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: Its life history and habitat preferences might be similar to those of Siphonops annulatus, and so it might be oviparous with direct development.
threats: There is no information on threats to this species.
population: There is no information on the population status of this species, which is known only from one specimen.
range: This species is known only from the holotype, collected in 1878 from "Brasilia". This locality almost certainly does not refer to the modern city of Brasilia (which did not exist in 1878), but rather more generally to Brazil. The range of this species is therefore unknown, though it is assumed to occur in eastern Brazil.
conservationActions: It is in need of taxonomic review (Wilkinson pers. comm.).

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of continuing uncertainties as to its extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: This is a subterranean species that has been found under bark, logs and stones in moist forest. It is likely to be oviparous, with eggs that develop directly.
threats: There is no information on threats to this species.
population: There is no information on the population status of this species, but it is a very difficult species to find.
range: There are only confirmed records of this species from Teresópolis, in Rio de Janeiro State in southern Brazil, at around 800m asl. It can be expected to occur more widely.
conservationActions: It is in need of taxonomic review (Wilkinson pers. comm.).

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of the absence of recent information on its extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: Its habitat and ecological preferences are not known, although it probably lays eggs that develop directly.
threats: The threats to this species are not known.
population: There is no information on the population status of this species.
range: This species is known only from the type locality, but the location of the type locality is not clear. This species was presumably collected in South America.
conservationActions: It is not known if the species occurs in protected areas.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of continuing doubts as to its taxonomic validity as well as absence of recent information on its extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: There is no information on its habitat and ecological preferences, although it is presumably a subterranean species.
threats: There is no information on threats to this species.
population: There is no information on the population of this species.
range: This species is known only from the non-specific type locality of "Ecuador" (Taylor 1968).
conservationActions: It is in need of taxonomic review (Wilkinson pers. comm.).

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of the absence of recent information on its extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: It is likely to be subterranean, possibly in lowland moist forest. It is also assumed to be oviparous with terrestrial eggs that develop directly, and to not be dependent on water for breeding.
threats: There is no information on threats to this species.
population: There is no information on the population status of this species, which is known only from two specimens.
range: This species is known only from a non-specific type locality in the state of Bahia in eastern Brazil. It has been suggested that the type locality is at the city of Salvador, but this is not certain.
conservationActions: A taxonomic review is needed for this species (Wilkinson pers. comm.)

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of the absence of recent information on its extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: There is no information available in the literature about its biology or ecology, although it might be similar to Chthonerpeton indistinctum, and be viviparous, with breeding taking place in water.
threats: There is no information on threats to this species.
population: There is no information on its population status; it is known only from the holotype.
range: This species is known only from the non-specific type locality of "Brazil" (Taylor 1968).
conservationActions: It is not known to occur in any protected areas.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of the absence of information on its extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: This species is presumably subterranean, and possibly occurs in lowland moist forest. It might be similar in ecology to Chthonerpeton indistinctum, and be viviparous, with breeding taking place in water.
threats: No information is available.
population: There is no information on its population status; only one specimen is known.
range: This species is known only from a non-specific type locality in the state of Bahia in eastern Brazil.
conservationActions: It is not known to occur in any protected areas.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of the absence of recent information on its extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: It is possibly like other members of the genus, in which case it is a subterranean and aquatic species, which would also presumably be viviparous with breeding taking place in water.
threats: There is no information on threats to this species.
population: There is no information on the population status of this species, which is known only from two specimens.
range: This species is known only from El Reventador, on the Amazonian slopes of the Andes in Napo Province, Ecuador, above 1,000m asl. It presumably occurs more widely.
conservationActions: The type locality is in the Reserva Ecológica Cayambe-Coca.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of the absence of recent information on its extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: The locality where the specimens were collected is unknown, and no information about the species' habitat is available. It is presumed to be an aquatic species, and to be viviparous.
threats: Threats to this species are unknown.
population: There is no information on its population status, and only three specimens are known.
range: This species is known only from the imprecise type locality of Rio Pandeiros, in north-west Minas Gerais State, Brazil.
conservationActions: It is not known from any protected areas.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of the absence of recent information on its extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: All that is known about its biology and ecological preferences is that it is a subterranean species.
threats: There is no information on threats to this species.
population: There is no information regarding its population status, and it is known only from the type specimen.
range: This species is known only from the non-specific type locality of São Paulo State, Brazil.
conservationActions: It is in need of taxonomic review (Wilkinson pers. comm.).

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of continuing doubts as to its taxonomic validity as well as complete absence of information on its extent of occurrence, status and ecological requirements.
habitat: This species is presumed to occur in tropical moist forest, where the adults are likely to be subterranean. It is also presumably oviparous with terrestrial eggs and aquatic larvae.
threats: There is no information on threats to this species.
population: There is no information on the population status of this species, which is known only from a single larva.
range: This species' geographic range is unknown. The type locality is unspecified, but is presumably in tropical Asia.
conservationActions: It is not known from any protected areas.

rationale: Taxonomic uncertainty. According to Seegers et al. (2004) the validity of its species status is doubtful. Possibly it is a junior synonym of Mormyrus hildebrandti. In the literature the species is known only from its holotype.
habitat: Max. size: 19.0 cm SL (after Froese and Pauly 2003).
threats: Fisheries (after Froese and Pauly 2003).
population: No information available.
range: Endemic to the Athi River system (Seeges et al. 2004).
conservationActions: None known.

rationale: More survey is required to determine the distribution range and population status.
habitat: Prefered habitat not known (Wildekamp 1995). Max. size: 18 mm TL (Wildekamp et al. in Daget et al. 1986).
threats: No information available.
population: No information available.
range: Lower reaches of rivers and brooks of the east coast drainage close to the sea, including salt pans.
conservationActions: No information available.

rationale: There is no data available on threats, population or range for A. apodus. Not collected since 1990 (Doadrio, I. pers comm).
habitat: No data.
threats: No data.
population: No data.
range: It is restricted northern Algeria. Not collected since 1990 (Doadrio, I. pers comm).
conservationActions: None.

rationale: Taxonomic uncertainty. According to Seegers et al. (2004) synonymy of M. hildebrandti with M. kannume by Boulenger (1898) is dubious and therefore not followed by them. Only known from its holotype.
habitat: No information available.
threats: No information available.
population: No information available.
range: Endemic to the Athi River system (including the Tsavo drainage and Mzima Springs) (see Seegers et al. 2004).
conservationActions: No information.

rationale: The species was described from collections made in the 1950s. The species has not been reported since. Presumed Extinct.
habitat: Not known.
threats: Drought, pollution and water extraction may have resulted in destroying available habitat for this species.
population: This fish is likely to now be extinct (M. Goren, pers. comm).
range: Known only from Damascus.
conservationActions: None known to be in place.

rationale: Listed as Endangered because its extent of occurrence is less than 5,000 km², there is continuing decline in the extent and quality of its habitat, and there are severe fluctuations in the number of mature individuals.
habitat: It is found on hard clay soils, with small shrubs, in semi-desert. It is an egg-laying species.
threats: Much of the habitat of this species (in particular the hard crust substrate) is threatened, or has been destroyed, by intensive agriculture, urbanisation and trampling by grazing animals.
population: It is relatively common within suitable habitat. There are substantial fluctuations in population size related to rainfall.
range: This is a recently described species from central Jordan. It is believed to have a relatively small range and is thought to be restricted to a specific habitat type.
conservationActions: It is not believed to occur in any protected areas.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of the absence of recent information on its extent of occurrence, population status and ecological requirements.
habitat: The exact distribution on the mountain is not known, and the habitat of the species is not known.
threats: The threats to this species are not known.
population: There is very little information is available. It is known only from two specimens collected in the 1800s.
range: This species known only from an undefined locality on Mount Orizaba, Veracruz State, Mexico. There have been several attempts to collect the species since its description but it has not been rediscovered. The elevation of collection is not known.
conservationActions: This species is protected by Mexican law under the category Pr (Special Protection). It is not known if the species is present in any protected areas. Further research is needed to rediscover this species.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient as there is very little information known about its range, population or threats. There are only 13 specimens known and it appears to be a very rare species.
habitat: There is no information available about the habitat of this species, but it is presumably terrestrial.
threats: The threats to this species are not known.
population: It is a very poorly known species, and it is probably rare. There are 13 known specimens.
range: This species is known from Sinaloa, Jalisco and Nayarit in Mexico. It may extend northward to southern Sonora and southwards in to Colima, but no specimens are known from there yet. It has been recorded between 16 and 1,589 m asl.
conservationActions: It is not known to occur in any protected areas. Further research into the distribution, ecology and threats to this species is needed.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient because it is currently known only from two specimens. More information on range, population and threats is needed in order to assess this species.
habitat: There is no information known about the habitats of this species.
threats: The threats to this species are not known.
population: It is known only from the two specimens, and the type specimen is lost. It is thought to be a very rare species.
range: This poorly-known species is endemic to Mexico, where it has only been recorded from Huajintlán, Morelos, 12 miles southwest of Puente de Ixtla (Smith and Taylor, 1945), and Matamoros, Puebla (Smith and Taylor 1950). The specimen collected from Morelos was originally designated as a neotype of Coniophanes lateritius, but was later shown to be C. melanocephalus (Wellman 1959).
conservationActions: It is not known to occur in any protected areas. Further research into the distribution, ecology and threats to this species is needed.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient because this species is still known only from a single record and there is very little information on habitat requirements, population status or range.
habitat: The habitat of this species is not known, but it is presumably terrestrial.
threats: Threats to this species are unknown.
population: The species is known only from a single record collected before the mid 1960s. Its current population status is unknown.
range: This species is known only from outside of Putla, in Oaxaca, Mexico, from 900 m asl. It may occur more widely than is currently known.
conservationActions: This species is protected by Mexican law under the category Pr (Special Protection). It is not known to occur in a protected area. Further research is needed to determine the range, population status, ecology and threats to this species.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient because this species has not been recorded for over 100 years, and there is no current information on ecology, threats or range.
habitat: The only known specimens were found in a coffee plantation. There is no other habitat information known about this species.
threats: Threats to this species are not known.
population: It has not been recorded since it was described in 1894.
range: This species is known only from the type locality, Pluma Hidalgo, in Oaxaca, Mexico, from approximately 1,400 m asl.
conservationActions: This species is protected by Mexican law under the category Pr (Special Protection). It is not known to occur in any protected area. Further information on range, population, ecology and threats is needed for this species.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of continuing doubts as to its taxonomic validity. There is an absence of recent information on its extent of occurrence, population status and ecological requirements.
habitat: The habitat preferences of this species are not known.
threats: Threats to this species are unknown.
population: It is known from only a couple of specimens, which are old. There is taxonomic uncertainty with this species.
range: The range of this species is still uncertain, some records come from Guerrero and others from Coalcoman, Michoacan, Mexico.
conservationActions: Taxonomic studies are needed to determine whether this is a valid species.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient since has only very recently been described and is still known from only two specimens and there is no information available about its ecology, range, population status or threats.
habitat: There is no information regarding the habitat in which the species was collected. Both specimens were road kill.
threats: There is no information on the threats to this species.
population: It is known only from two specimens, both of which were road kill. There is no information known about the population status of this species.
range: This Mexican endemic species is known from two specimens; one from the type locality "km 236.2 hwy 16 Chihuahua-Hermosillo", in the state of Sonora, at 1,643 m asl, and one from "km 36 on the autotrail Temoris-Chínipas", in the municipality of Guazapares, in the state of Chihuahua at 1,563 m asl.
conservationActions: It is not known whether this species occurs in a protected area.  Further specimens of this species are needed to confirm its taxonomic status.  More information on range, population, ecology and threats is also needed.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of continuing uncertainties on its taxonomy, extent of occurrence, ecological requirements, threats and conservation status.
habitat: There is no information available on the habitat and ecology of this species.
threats: The threats to this species remain unknown.
population: Apparently known only from the holotype (Fitch and Henderson 1973, Lieb 1981, Nieto-Montes de Oca 1996).
range: This species appears to be known only from the holotype, collected at the undefined locality of "México" (Fitch and Henderson 1973, Lieb 1981, Nieto-Montes de Oca 1996). In view of the uncertainty about the species geographic range, no map has been prepared.
conservationActions: There are no direct conservation measures in place; it is not known if the species is present in any protected areas. Further studies are needed into the taxonomy, distribution, abundance, reproduction and ecology, and potential threats to this species.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of the absence of recent information on its extent of occurrence, ecological requirements, threats and conservation status.
habitat: The habitat and ecology of this species remain unknown. One of the specimens contained a single, large intact egg; with other immature eggs present (Alvarez del Toro and Smith 1956).
threats: The threats to this species are not known.
population: It is apparently known only from two female specimens.
range: This Mexican species appears to be known only from the type series of two adult females collected at El Ocote, in the State of Chiapas at 600 m asl (Alvarez del Toro and Smith 1956). The location of the 'El Ocote' location where the species was collected at is unclear as there is more than one in this region, hence the species is not mapped here.
conservationActions: There are no direct conservation measures in place for this species. It is not known if the species is present within any protected areas. Additional studies are needed into the distribution (including field surveys close to El Ocote), abundance, breeding biology and general ecology of this species.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient in view of the absence of recent information on its extent of occurrence, ecological requirements, threats and conservation status.
habitat: This is a poorly known animal, for which there is very little information available on the habitat and ecological requirements.
threats: The threats to this species remain unknown.
population: The abundance of this species is not known.
range: This little-known Mexican endemic appears to have been collected at a number of sites in Guerrero State (Davis 1954, Liner and Dundee 1969); it possibly also occurs in adjacent Oaxaca. The holotype was collected 'one mile southwest of Tierra Colorada, 900 ft' (Davis 1954). The type series appears to have been collected at around 300 m asl (900 to 1,000 ft).
conservationActions: This species is protected by Mexican law under the category Pr (Special Protection). It is not known if the species is present within any protected areas. Additional studies are needed into the distribution, abundance, breeding biology, general ecology and potential threats to this species.

rationale: Listed as Data Deficient on the basis that both the provenance and validity of this species are unclear and because, with no reliable information on its collecting locality and because it is known only from the holotype, nothing is known of its distribution, population status, natural history or exposure and sensitivity to any threats.
habitat: Nothing is known about the ecology of this species, as its true collecting locality is uncertain.
threats: It is unknown whether any threats exist to this species.
population: This species is known only from the holotype.
range: This species was described from Porto Novo in Benin, however, this locality is uncertain (see Taxonomic Note), and it has not been relocated in subsequent surveys.
useTrade: This species is not known to be used or traded.
